attributes.action: stop benefit discrimination against those living as a 'Family Unit'
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Please read the following, then decide if current government policies support the ‘Family Unit’ as they claim to do. If  you agree that they in fact don’t then please sign this petition.

At present of you are living with your partner, and either of you have lost your job, you are not eligible for Jobseeker’s Allowance or Income Support unless your partner works less than 16 hours a week, and is on a very low wage.

The direct result of this, to put it simply, is that your partner has to support you entirely. That is, they have to pay: all the rent/mortgage, bills, full council tax and prescription charges etc. 

However, if you are in a long-term relationship, but not living together – even if you have children together – you will be eligible for benefits, housing, pay no council tax, free prescriptions and so on.

My M.P, agreed with me that this amounted to discrimination against couples who live together. 

Thank you for taking the time to read this petition, and I hope you will support it by signing it.

With thanks,

Edward Somerville BA (Hons.) MA
